@leaving_this_blank_ Not at all. Toxic masculinity is the concept that men aren’t “real men” if they respect women, believe equal rights, defend homosexuality, or act in any way that might emasculate them (crying, for example). Men who are often deemed to show “toxic masculinity” generally respond to something like “sex worker raped by politician” with “well, she’s a whore! She gets paid for it, that means it can’t be rape”. They also generally reply to the word “feminism”, or anything to do with it, with a wrath that rivals Satan. All because we just want to be treated with respect. Because we have the audacity to stand up and say “SOME men are shit”. The toxic PEOPLE will come out and shut us down, telling us WE’RE the shit ones and we deserve being TREATED like shit because of our gender, race, sexual orientation etc. But mostly it just translated to fear. And for the record, I don’t believe in “mansplaining”. Just in PEOPLE who refuse to open their mind to other opinions/possibilities. Men are not the only PEOPLE who can be toxic. Women are absolutely capable, and “toxic femininity” exists too. Except, that’s when women just shit on PEOPLE (yes, other women too) because they’re cunts. Does that make sense?

@leaving_this_blank_ You’re right, mate. Back in the 19th century, it absolutely WAS all about women. They fought for EQUAL OPPORTUNITY because they weren’t allowed to work, vote, speak, think, have a say over their own bodies/lives. But feminism has evolved since then. It literally means “equal rights between the sexes” (look it up). And since you brought it up, allow me to name just a few things feminism has done for MEN: Ensured men get the vital reproductive health services they need; taken the pressure off men to be the “breadwinners” of a household; successfully changed the legal definition of “rape” to include men as victims instead of just women; made it possible to charge an abusive female partner with assault, stalking, or any other behaviour that endangers men; started the fight against gender roles, which INCLUDES liberating men from harmful stereotypes (like the ones that create toxic masculinity). So fine, I agree, feminism WAS about men. But don’t say it never did anything for them. Equal rights. That’s all.
@mallalee feminism was about women, always has been, always will be, in was never in favor or has ever helped men
